decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruption cards like Prismatic Ending and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and protect your creatures. The deck aims to outpace the opponent with fast threats while disrupting their game plan with removal and bounce effects. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to create a challenging and dynamic game plan for the opponent to navigate.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using UrzaTron lands, powerful Eldrazi creatures, and disruptive spells. By assembling Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower, the player can generate a lot of mana to cast devastating Eldrazi like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer. With cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, the deck can also control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of powerful threats and control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact to reduce the cost of multicolored spells, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Additionally, cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Lightning Bolt provide additional pressure and removal options. The deck aims to establish an aggressive board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game, ultimately aiming to outpace and outpace the opponent.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly and cast multiple spells in a single turn to create a storm count. By using spells like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual along with Ral, Monsoon Mage, the deck can then finish off the opponent with a copied Grapeshot or by casting a large Exponential Gaze. The deck also includes ways to dig through the deck quickly with cards like Reckless Impulse and Valakut Awakening to find the necessary combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with multiple artifacts, utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and fuel the ability of Arcbound Ravager to grow and become a threat. Urza's Saga also plays a key role in the deck, providing additional artifact tokens to sacrifice for value. The inclusion of Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt allows for disruption against opposing strategies, while Sink into Stupor can provide card advantage and slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive affinity strategy.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans and maintain control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Counterspell, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Psychic Frog and Graveyard Trespasser can be used to provide extra value and card advantage. The deck also includes a few finishers like Murktide Regent to close out the game once the opponent is under control.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive gameplay using a combination of Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It utilizes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones to disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing damage quickly with efficient creatures like Nethergoyf. By combining hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures, Mono Black Aggro aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory before they can set up their own strategy.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures with toolbox abilities to create explosive combos and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Spymaster's Vault, the deck can search for specific creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician or Grist, the Hunger Tide to control the board and generate advantage. With the ability to recur creatures from the graveyard and generate extra value from sacrificing creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its flexibility and synergy among its creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing land ramp and mana acceleration to quickly assemble the Amulet Titan combo, which involves cheating Primeval Titan into play early and searching for key lands such as Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage. The deck also includes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift to further enable the combo and provide additional win conditions. The key strategy is to efficiently manage land drops and maximize the synergy between lands and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and applying pressure to the opponent. It utilizes efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, to deal damage and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide additional support and advantage to maintain the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive gameplay style, pushing for a quick win before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and utilizing a diverse range of mana colors to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, alongside spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt for removal and direct damage. The inclusion of Leyline cards helps to boost the effectiveness of multi-colored cards while also providing protection. The deck also includes control elements like Stubborn Denial and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board advantage.

This deck uses a combination of creatures with toolbox abilities to create powerful combos and synergies. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Yawgmoth, Thran Physician's abilities to sacrifice creatures for card advantage and board control, while also utilizing Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key creatures such as Young Wolf and Endurance. Malevolent Rumble and Agatha's Soul Cauldron provide additional ways to generate card advantage and disrupt opponents. The deck also includes ways to recur creatures from the graveyard and generate extra mana for explosive plays.

This deck focuses on efficiently casting spells that produce mana to power out a storm combo that can deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. The key strategy involves using cards like Ruby Medallion, Pyretic Ritual, and Desperate Ritual to generate mana quickly, while also utilizing cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to finish off the opponent. By chaining together spells and managing resources effectively, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using discard spells and self-mill effects to fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with reanimation spells like Victimize. The goal is to cheat out large threats like Archon of Cruelty early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures that can swing the game in your favor. The combo aspect comes from the synergy between cards that fill the graveyard and those that bring creatures back, creating a powerful engine that can quickly take over the game.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, quickly dealing damage and controlling the board. The deck focuses on a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and buffs to the creatures. Thraben Charm and Voice of Victory offer versatility and disruption, while Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor provide additional value and card advantage. Static Prison helps control the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on controlling the game early on with ramp and removal spells, while aiming to drop powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Kozilek's Return for additional board control, and aims to quickly ramp into its big threats with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple. With a mix of removal, ramp, and powerful creatures, this deck looks to establish dominance and control the game from start to finish.
